comments.raw_text:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.3b) Gecko/20030205 Phoenix/0.5 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.3b) Gecko/20030205 Phoenix/0.5 In the internal page of my company, text appear passing a right column boundary (containing a gif), which should not pass. It should look like framed in cells, and it does not. The whole page is designed that way, so, the final result is that all the text expands the window width to double. Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Launch phoenix 2. connect to that page. 3. Actual Results: (see details) Expected Results: Mozilla, Netscape and Phoenix behaves the same way with this page. I enclose the html source code of the buggy page: -- Inside home

comments.creator: jesus.renero@terra.es
djst@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Geez, you're not doing much right in this bug report.

First of all, this is most probably a Mozilla bug, not a Phoenix bug. Also, this
is most likely a duplicate. Finally, you have submitted a HUGE page directly in
the bug report (not as an attachment or a simplified testcase). 

Marking this bug INVALID. If you're going to submit a new bug, make sure you
read this document carefully first: http://texturizer.net/phoenix/bugs.html
